title.native: 真剣で私に恋しなさい！
title.romaji: Maji de Watashi ni Koi Shinasai!

description:
It's one thing to honor your ancestors and keep old traditions alive, but there IS such a thing as taking it to a ridiculous extreme. In Kawakami City, having a samurai ancestor and enormous 'fighting spirit' isn't just an interesting fact, it's a huge part of how you end up being ranked on the social totem pole. That, in turn, rolls over into the school curriculum. Fortunately, that's something the local kids like Yamato Naoe have learned to deal with by forming into small 'bands,' (that's the samurai type, NOT music). However, while the delicate sexual balance of Yamato's group seemed fine when there were three girls and four boys, the sudden addition of two MORE girls starts to send everything spinning out of control!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

__Height:__ 159cm
__Nicknames:__ いしずか (Ishizuka), 静様 (Shizuka-sama), (静) 御前 ("Shizuka" Gozen)

[Profile (Ken Production)](https://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/8) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/beerlover-shizuka/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shizuka_Itō) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤静)

She married on December 5, 2012, her 32nd birthday, but later announced her divorce on April 30, 2020.

She was part of the seiyuu unit with [Hitomi Nabatame](https://anilist.co/staff/95184/) called "Hitomi Nabatame to Shizuka Itou" (生天目仁美と伊藤静) under Geneon's cosmic★motion label. Together they are known by the name Hitoshizuku (ひとしずく).

__Height:__ 160 cm

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/Julia320) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/PC18Kamishiro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuu_asakawa_insta/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y%C5%AB_Asakawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B5%85%E5%B7%9D%E6%82%A0)

She is a voice actress and singer. She is currently a freelancer, but used to be affiliated with Arts Vision until October 1, 2014. 
She was previously married to [Shoutaro Morikubo](https://anilist.co/staff/95178) (married in 2007; divorced in 2009)

**Non-anime roles:**
• Belle - Memento Mori (VG)
• [Megurine Luka](https://anilist.co/staff/194185/Megurine-Luka) - Vocaloid
• [Kino Hime](https://anilist.co/character/25447/Kino-Hime) _[Seiyuu-ka](https://anilist.co/manga/44633/Seiyuu-Ka/)_ (Drama CD)

Christopher Owen Ayres was an American voice actor, ADR director and scriptwriter who worked on a number of Japanese anime series at Seraphim Digital/Sentai Filmworks, Funimation, OkraTron 5000 and New Generation Pictures. He got his start voice acting at ADV Films on Kino's Journey as an extra. In anime, he was known as the voice of Frieza from Dragon Ball Z Kai, Kei Kurono from Gantz, Prince Soma from Black Butler, and Shingen Takeda from the Sengoku Basara series. He is also known for Mock Combat for Cosplay panels at anime conventions.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Chris died on October 18, 2021 due to health complications. He had previously been treated for COPD/emphysema by receiving a double lung transplant.

[Profile (Axl One)](http://www.axl-one.com/talent/tomonaga.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akanet1202)

Non-Anime Roles:
- Kaku Bunwa (Ei) in "Koihime Musou" (Visual Novel)
- Kaku Bunwa (Ei) in "Shin Koihime Musou" (Visual Novel)
- Rika in "Makai Tenshi Jibril" (Visual Novel)
- Rika in "Makai Tenshi Jibril -episode2-" (Visual Novel)
- Rika in "Makai Tenshi Jibril 3" (Visual Novel)
- Sorai Saki in "Blue Archive" (VG)
Hobbies:  Driving Listening to music Taking walks Watching movies Skills & Abilities:  Dance Skipping rope

[Website](https://endoh-masaaki.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBnCeOigma9Cv6eI5_QleQQ) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/遠藤正明) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masaaki_Endoh)

Masaaki Endou is a Japanese singer-songwriter who is prominent in the area of soundtracks for anime and tokusatsu productions. He is one of the founders of the Anison band JAM Project and has been a regular member ever since its inception in 2000. His nickname is the "Young Lion of Anison" and he goes by the motto "Always Full Voice".

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makoto_myzk) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宮崎誠)

A music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/makoto_myzk) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宮崎誠)

A music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rsknkns)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rsknkns/)__

Ryousuke Nakanishi is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and musician, while also known as the representative director of Altus Inc. and managing director Up Dream Inc. He is also a member of the Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers.

[Official Website ](http://kitadani-hiroshi.com/)

In November 1994 he officially started his career in a trio called [STRAGGER]. In July 1998, he released a solo album and an year later, in November 1999, the opening song "We Are!" for the One Piece anime marked his debut as an anison singer. Shortly after, at the end of 1999, he joined the Lapis Lazuli band.  In August 2002 he become a regular member in [JAM Project (Japanese Animationsong Makers)](https://anilist.co/staff/102041/JAM-Project) where he is active even today.
